# init(_:withObjCType:)

**Initializer**

Creates a value object containing the specified value, interpreted with the specified Objective-C type.

## Declaration

```swift
init(_ value: UnsafeRawPointer, withObjCType type: UnsafePointer<CChar>)
```

## Parameters

- **value**: A pointer to data to be stored in the new value object.
- **type**: The Objective-C type of `value`, as provided by the `@encode()` compiler directive. Do not hard-code this parameter as a C string.

## Return Value

A new value object that contains `value`, which is interpreted as being of the Objective-C type `type`.

## Discussion

This method has the same effect as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue/valueWithBytes:objCType:] and may be deprecated in a future release. You should use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue/valueWithBytes:objCType:] instead.

## Working with Raw Values

- **init(bytes:objCType:)**: Initializes a value object to contain the specified value, interpreted with the specified Objective-C type.
- **getValue(_:)**: Copies the value into the specified buffer.
- **objCType**: A C string containing the Objective-C type of the data contained in the value object.
